Title: Verify Empty Loads Creation Validation
Description:
1. Navigate to job file creation
2. Attempt to create loads without proper prerequisites
3. Verify validation messages
4. Complete prerequisites and create loads
5. Verify successful creation
Preconditions: - User has valid credentials\n- User is in domestic workflow\n- Job file is accessible
Expected Result:
- System validates prerequisites before load creation
- Appropriate error messages shown for missing prerequisites
- Loads are created successfully after prerequisites met
- Load IDs are generated and unique
- Loads appear in load management screen
Tags: PB-3176, Prerequisites, Validation, Load Creation

Title: Verify Import Orders Drawer Accessibility
Description:
1. Open job file with empty loads
2. Verify Import Orders drawer is accessible
3. Click Import Orders drawer/button
4. Verify drawer opens correctly
5. Verify both options are visible
6. Test drawer closing functionality
Preconditions: - Empty loads exist in job file\n- User has appropriate permissions\n- Import Orders functionality is enabled
Expected Result:
- Import Orders drawer is visible and clickable
- Drawer opens smoothly with animation
- Two options clearly displayed: 'Select Orders' and 'Import Orders'
- Drawer can be closed by clicking outside or close button
- UI remains responsive during drawer operations
Tags: PB-3176, Import Orders Drawer, UI Accessibility, Navigation

Title: Verify Order Manager Navigation Integration
Description:
1. Open Import Orders drawer
2. Click 'Select Orders' option
3. Verify navigation to Order Manager
4. Verify Order Manager loads correctly
5. Test back navigation to job file
6. Verify context is maintained
Preconditions: - Import Orders drawer is functional\n- Order Manager is accessible\n- Navigation system is working
Expected Result:
- Clicking 'Select Orders' navigates to Order Manager
- Order Manager loads with all existing orders
- User can browse and select orders
- Back navigation returns to job file
- Job file context is preserved
- Selected orders can be transferred back
Tags: PB-3176, Navigation, Order Manager Integration, Context Preservation

Title: Verify Order File Format Validation
Description:
1. Prepare invalid order files:
   - File with wrong extension
   - File with corrupted data
   - File with missing required fields
   - Empty file
2. Attempt to upload each invalid file
3. Verify error messages
4. Upload valid file for comparison
Preconditions: - Invalid order files are available\n- Valid order file is available for comparison\n- File upload functionality is working
Expected Result:
- Wrong extension files show appropriate error
- Corrupted data files show validation error
- Missing field files show specific field error
- Empty files show 'no data' error
- Valid file uploads successfully
- Error messages are clear and actionable
- User can retry upload after fixing issues
Tags: PB-3176, File Validation, Error Handling, Data Integrity

Title: Verify Order Manager Registration Accuracy
Description:
1. Upload order file with 10 orders
2. Note order IDs from file
3. Navigate to Order Manager
4. Verify all 10 orders are registered
5. Check order details match file content
6. Verify no duplicate registrations
7. Verify order status is correct
Preconditions: - Valid order file with 10 orders is available\n- Order Manager is accessible\n- File upload functionality works
Expected Result:
- All 10 orders appear in Order Manager
- Order IDs match exactly with file content
- Order details (customer, location, etc.) are accurate
- No duplicate orders exist
- Order status shows as 'Available' or appropriate status
- Order Manager count matches file order count
- Data integrity is maintained
Tags: PB-3176, Order Manager, Data Registration, Accuracy

Title: Verify Clear Orders Button State Management
Description:
1. Import orders to job file
2. Verify Clear Orders button is enabled
3. Clear all orders
4. Verify button state changes
5. Import orders again
6. Verify button re-enables
Preconditions: - Orders can be imported to job file\n- Clear Orders functionality works\n- UI state management is functional
Expected Result:
- Clear Orders button is enabled when orders exist
- Button is disabled when no orders in job file
- Button re-enables when orders are imported again
- Visual state changes are clear (color, cursor)
- Button text remains consistent
- State changes are immediate and responsive
Tags: PB-3176, UI State Management, Button States, User Experience

Title: Verify Move Orders Multi-Select Functionality
Description:
1. Import 10 orders to job file
2. Test individual order selection
3. Test multiple order selection
4. Test select all functionality
5. Test deselect all functionality
6. Verify selection count display
7. Verify Move Orders button state
Preconditions: - Multiple orders are available in job file\n- Selection functionality is working\n- Move Orders button is present
Expected Result:
- Individual orders can be selected/deselected
- Multiple orders can be selected simultaneously
- Select all selects all visible orders
- Deselect all clears all selections
- Selection count is displayed accurately
- Move Orders button enables with selections
- Visual feedback for selections is clear
Tags: PB-3176, Multi-Select, UI Interaction, Selection Management

Title: Verify Load Selection Window Functionality
Description:
1. Create 5 empty loads (Load-A to Load-E)
2. Select orders in job file
3. Click Move Orders button
4. Verify load selection window opens
5. Test load selection
6. Verify window closes after selection
7. Test cancel functionality
Preconditions: - Multiple empty loads exist\n- Orders are selected for movement\n- Move Orders button is functional
Expected Result:
- Load selection window opens showing all load IDs
- All 5 loads (Load-A to Load-E) are displayed
- User can click on any load to select it
- Selection is visually indicated
- Window closes after load selection
- Cancel option closes window without action
- Selected load receives the orders
Tags: PB-3176, Load Selection, Window Management, User Interaction

Title: Verify Location-Based Auto-Grouping Edge Cases
Description:
1. Create orders with same location but different details
2. Create orders with similar location names
3. Create orders with special characters in location names
4. Test auto-grouping for each scenario
5. Verify grouping accuracy
Preconditions: - Orders with various location formats exist\n- Auto-grouping functionality works\n- Location data is properly configured
Expected Result:
- Orders with same location are grouped together
- Orders with similar names are grouped correctly
- Special characters in location names don't break grouping
- Grouping preserves order selection sequence
- Each location appears as separate activity
- No duplicate location activities created
Tags: PB-3176, Location Grouping, Edge Cases, Data Processing

Title: Verify Load Management Activity Expansion
Description:
1. Create load with multiple locations and orders
2. Navigate to Load Management screen
3. Test activity expansion/collapse
4. Verify order display in expanded view
5. Test multiple activities expansion
6. Verify performance with many activities
Preconditions: - Load with multiple activities exists\n- Load Management screen is accessible\n- Expansion functionality works
Expected Result:
- Activities can be expanded individually
- Expanded activities show all order IDs
- Multiple activities can be expanded simultaneously
- Order chips are clearly displayed
- Expansion/collapse is smooth and responsive
- Performance remains good with many activities
- UI doesn't freeze or lag
Tags: PB-3176, Load Management, Activity Expansion, Performance

Title: Verify Order Chip Removal Validation
Description:
1. Create load with orders in multiple activities
2. Test removing order chips from different activities
3. Verify order returns to Import Orders
4. Test removing all orders from activity
5. Verify activity state after order removal
Preconditions: - Load with orders in multiple activities exists\n- Order chip removal functionality works\n- Import Orders section is accessible
Expected Result:
- Removing order chip removes order from activity
- Removed order appears in Import Orders section
- Order is available for reassignment
- Removing all orders from activity leaves empty activity
- Empty activity remains in load structure
- No errors occur during removal
- Data integrity is maintained
Tags: PB-3176, Order Removal, Data Validation, State Management

Title: Verify Update Loads Drawer Load Information
Description:
1. Create loads with different configurations:
   - Load-X: Truck, 30.5 CBM, 6000kg
   - Load-Y: Van, 12.0 CBM, 2000kg
   - Load-Z: Trailer, 45.0 CBM, 8000kg
2. Open Update Loads drawer
3. Verify load information display
4. Test expandable functionality
5. Verify information accuracy
Preconditions: - Loads with different configurations exist\n- Update Loads drawer is accessible\n- Load information is properly configured
Expected Result:
- All load IDs are displayed in drawer
- Each load shows vehicle type, CBM, and weight
- Load-X shows: Truck, 30.5 CBM, 6000kg
- Load-Y shows: Van, 12.0 CBM, 2000kg
- Load-Z shows: Trailer, 45.0 CBM, 8000kg
- Information is clearly formatted and labeled
- Data matches actual load configuration
Tags: PB-3176, Update Loads, Data Display, Information Accuracy

Title: Verify Cross-Load Order Movement
Description:
1. Create Load-100 with orders O-1001, O-1002, O-1003
2. Create Load-101 with orders O-1004, O-1005
3. Open Update Loads drawer
4. Move O-1001 from Load-100 to Load-101
5. Move O-1004 from Load-101 to Load-100
6. Verify both loads updated correctly
Preconditions: - Two loads with orders exist\n- Update Loads drawer is functional\n- Order movement functionality works
Expected Result:
- O-1001 is removed from Load-100 and added to Load-101
- O-1004 is removed from Load-101 and added to Load-100
- Load-100 now contains O-1002, O-1003, O-1004
- Load-101 now contains O-1001, O-1005
- Order counts are updated correctly
- Location grouping is maintained in target loads
- No data loss occurs during transfer
Tags: PB-3176, Cross-Load Movement, Data Transfer, Load Management

Title: Verify Optimization Counter Reset Scenarios
Description:
1. Create new job file
2. Verify counter starts at 0
3. Perform optimizations and verify increments
4. Create new job file
5. Verify counter resets to 0
6. Test counter persistence across sessions
Preconditions: - Multiple job files can be created\n- Optimization functionality works\n- Counter system is functional
Expected Result:
- New job file shows counter at 0
- Counter increments with each optimization
- Creating new job file resets counter to 0
- Counter persists within same job file session
- Counter is accurate and reliable
- No counter corruption or incorrect values
Tags: PB-3176, Optimization Counter, State Management, Data Persistence

Title: Verify Route Optimization Algorithm Accuracy
Description:
1. Create load with known optimal route
2. Set up locations with calculated distances
3. Perform optimization
4. Verify selected route matches expected optimal route
5. Calculate and verify total mileage
6. Test with multiple route scenarios
Preconditions:
- Load with multiple locations exists
- Location distances are known/calculated
- Optimization algorithm is functional
- Expected optimal routes are predetermined
Expected Result:
- Optimizer selects route with lowest total mileage
- Selected route matches expected optimal route
- Total mileage calculation is accurate
- Algorithm consistently finds optimal solutions
- Multiple scenarios produce correct results
- Optimization results are deterministic
Tags: PB-3176, Route Optimization, Algorithm Accuracy, Business Logic

Title: Verify Global vs Per-Load Optimization Differences
Description:
1. Create 3 loads with different route complexities
2. Perform per-load optimization on Load-1
3. Verify only Load-1 is optimized
4. Reset routes
5. Perform global optimization
6. Verify all loads are optimized
7. Compare optimization results
Preconditions: - Multiple loads with routes exist\n- Both global and per-load optimization work\n- Routes can be reset/manipulated
Expected Result:
- Per-load optimization affects only selected load
- Other loads remain unchanged during per-load optimization
- Global optimization processes all loads
- Global optimization may produce different results than individual optimizations
- Optimization counter increments appropriately for each type
- Both methods produce valid optimized routes
Tags: PB-3176, Optimization Types, Scope Validation, Algorithm Comparison

Title: Verify Icon Tooltip Functionality
Description:
1. Navigate to load management screen
2. Hover over Edit Load Data icon
3. Verify tooltip appears and content
4. Hover over Duplicate icon
5. Verify tooltip appears and content
6. Hover over Delete icon
7. Verify tooltip appears and content
8. Test all new action button tooltips
Preconditions: - Load management screen is accessible\n- All icons are present and functional\n- Tooltip system is working
Expected Result:
- Edit Load Data icon shows appropriate tooltip
- Duplicate icon shows appropriate tooltip
- Delete icon shows appropriate tooltip
- Optimise button shows 'Optimise' tooltip
- Update Load button shows 'Update Load' tooltip
- Import Orders button shows 'Import Orders' tooltip
- All tooltips appear within 0.5 seconds
- Tooltips are clear and descriptive
Tags: PB-3176, Tooltips, Icon Functionality, User Experience

Title: Verify Duplicate Load Data Preservation
Description:
1. Create Load-200 with:
   - Vehicle Type: Truck
   - CBM: 25.0
   - Weight: 5000kg
   - Location A: Orders O-2001, O-2002
   - Location B: Order O-2003
2. Duplicate Load-200 to create Load-201
3. Verify Load-201 structure
4. Verify Load-201 data preservation
Preconditions: - Load with complete configuration exists\n- Duplicate functionality works\n- Load data is properly configured
Expected Result:
- Load-201 is created with same structure as Load-200
- Load-201 has Vehicle Type: Truck
- Load-201 has CBM: 25.0
- Load-201 has Weight: 5000kg
- Load-201 has Location A and Location B
- Load-201 has NO orders in any location
- Original Load-200 remains unchanged
- Data integrity is maintained
Tags: PB-3176, Duplicate Load, Data Preservation, Structure Maintenance

Title: Verify Delete Load Data Cleanup
Description:
1. Create Load-300 with orders and configuration
2. Move orders to other loads or clear them
3. Delete Load-300
4. Verify complete removal
5. Verify no orphaned data remains
6. Verify system integrity
Preconditions: - Load with data exists\n- Orders can be moved/cleared\n- Delete functionality works
Expected Result:
- Load-300 is completely removed from system
- No references to Load-300 remain
- Load ID is no longer visible in any screen
- No orphaned data or references exist
- System integrity is maintained
- Other loads are unaffected
- Database cleanup is complete
Tags: PB-3176, Delete Load, Data Cleanup, System Integrity

Title: Verify Single Order Deletion Warning Variations
Description:
1. Create load with single order in different activity types
2. Test deletion from loading activity
3. Test deletion from unloading activity
4. Test deletion from service activity
5. Verify consistent warning behavior
Preconditions: - Load with single orders in different activities exists\n- Order deletion functionality works\n- Warning system is functional
Expected Result:
- Warning popup appears for single order in any activity type
- Message is consistent: 'Do you want to delete the activity along with the order'
- Three buttons (Yes, No, Cancel) are present in all cases
- Tooltips are consistent across activity types
- Behavior is uniform regardless of activity type
- User experience is consistent
Tags: PB-3176, Single Order Deletion, Warning Consistency, Activity Types

Title: Verify Order Manager Data Synchronization Scenarios
Description:
1. Import orders via file upload
2. Move some orders to loads
3. Clear some orders with different options
4. Delete some orders from activities
5. Verify Order Manager reflects all changes
6. Test data consistency across operations
Preconditions: - Multiple order operations can be performed\n- Order Manager is accessible\n- Data synchronization works
Expected Result:
- Order Manager accurately reflects all order states
- Moved orders remain in Order Manager
- Cleared orders (No option) remain in Order Manager
- Cleared orders (Yes option) are removed from Order Manager
- Deleted orders return to Import Orders but stay in Order Manager
- Order Manager count is always accurate
- No data inconsistencies exist
Tags: PB-3176, Data Synchronization, Order Manager, Integration

Title: Verify UI Responsiveness Under Load
Description:
1. Create 50 loads with 10 orders each (500 total orders)
2. Test UI responsiveness during:
   - Load management screen navigation
   - Activity expansion/collapse
   - Order selection operations
   - Drawer opening/closing
3. Monitor performance metrics
Preconditions: - Large dataset (50 loads, 500 orders) exists\n- UI performance monitoring is available\n- System has adequate resources
Expected Result:
- UI remains responsive during all operations
- Screen navigation is smooth
- Activity expansion/collapse is fast
- Order selection is responsive
- Drawers open/close quickly
- No UI freezing or lag
- Memory usage remains stable
- Performance meets acceptable thresholds
Tags: PB-3176, Performance, UI Responsiveness, Load Testing

Title: Verify Error Recovery and User Guidance
Description:
1. Intentionally trigger various error conditions
2. Test error message clarity
3. Verify recovery options
4. Test user guidance for resolution
5. Verify system returns to stable state
Preconditions: - Error conditions can be triggered\n- Error handling system is functional\n- User guidance is available
Expected Result:
- Error messages are clear and actionable
- Recovery options are provided
- User guidance helps resolve issues
- System returns to stable state after error resolution
- No data corruption occurs during errors
- User experience remains positive despite errors
- Error logging is appropriate
Tags: PB-3176, Error Handling, User Experience, Recovery

Title: Verify Accessibility and Usability Compliance
Description:
1. Test keyboard navigation through all features
2. Test screen reader compatibility
3. Test color contrast and visibility
4. Test responsive design on different screen sizes
5. Test user workflow efficiency
Preconditions:
- Accessibility tools are available
- Different screen sizes can be tested
- Keyboard navigation works
- Screen reader is available
Expected Result:
- All features are keyboard accessible
- Screen reader can navigate interface
- Color contrast meets accessibility standards
- UI is responsive on different screen sizes
- User workflows are efficient and intuitive
- Navigation is logical and consistent
- Accessibility compliance is maintained
Tags: PB-3176, Accessibility, Usability, Compliance
